pr_title: [#9993] Add Access Control Tests for Actions from API Endpoints

timeline.bodyText: I think here can be more consistent with style by just using if as guarding clause.
timeline.author: Derek-Hardy

timeline.bodyText: Maybe can have one arg on the same line as method name?
timeline.author: Derek-Hardy
Derek-Hardy

timeline.bodyText: The check can be (and should be) inside getStudentOfCourseFromRequest to save the duplicated code.
timeline.author: xpdavid
xpdavid

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we use gateKeeper.verifyLoggedInUserPrivileges(); for any null check for userInfo?
timeline.author: xpdavid
xpdavid

timeline.bodyText: We should just throw the exception instead of keep it silent? Same for other places.
timeline.author: xpdavid

timeline.bodyText: As the we are setting the privilege to true, it is better to name the method as grantPrivilege instead of updatePrivilge.
timeline.author: xpdavid

timeline.bodyText:
The error message is not correct as instructor can call the method to access moderated/preview person.
Actually, I think it is not the method's responsibility to verify the login privilege here. As long as the pre-condition for getStudentOfCourseFromRequest is fulfilled, it should executed.
i.e.

The login check should be only verified at orElseGet
Other login privilege check should be in checkAccessControlForStudentFeedbackSubmission (e.g., to verify it is logged in when access as preview person)
timeline.author: xpdavid

timeline.bodyText: So you can delete the check?
timeline.author: xpdavid
xpdavid
xpdavid
xpdavid

replies.bodyText: I think this was automatically added from my IDE for empty switch block. I'm guessing the original intent is for it to cascade to the next block right?
replies.author: madanalogy

timeline.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: Removing this null check throws a NPE in verifyOnlyInstructorsOfTheSameCourseCanAccess under testAccessControl_instructorAccessHisCourseInstructorResult_shouldPass
replies.author: madanalogy

timeline.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: Removing this null check throws a NPE in verifyInaccessibleWithoutLogin under testAccessControl_withoutCorrectAuthInfoAccessStudentResult_shouldFail
replies.author: madanalogy

replies.bodyText: Then it's time to figure out which part of code result in the NPE. (Does the NPE cause by accessing userInfo without checking login privilege? If yes, should the method be responsible to check the login privilege?)
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: The NPE was caused by calling the action's checkSpecificAccessControl from the test case verifyInaccessibleWithoutLogin which specifically logs the user out. Since the action here is generated from the ActionFactory in WebApiServlet (if I'm not mistaken), it's feasible that someone could attempt to manually submit a request to our backend to request for the resource mapped to this action. Currently the server manages this by throwing an NPE since it can't get the userInfo.
replies.author: madanalogy

replies.bodyText: Ahh. I see. I thought it is the same code related to feedback submission while it is not.
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: Yeap, the feedback submission has no issues when I remove the extra checks as you pointed out. I'll rectify that first and request for your review afterwards.
replies.author: madanalogy

timeline.bodyText:
I think only is not necessary

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                protected void grantInstructorWithOnlySectionPrivilege(InstructorAttributes instructor,
          
          
            
                protected void grantInstructorWithSectionPrivilege(InstructorAttributes instructor,
timeline.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText:
I think @Derek-Hardy has brought this up for the indentation. However, it is not ideal to put one param "up" for very long method.
See https://oss-generic.github.io/process/codingStandards/CodingStandard-Java.html
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText:
A side note: we have moved the coding standard to https://se-education.org/guides/conventions/java/index.html
No changes to contents though.
replies.author: damithc

timeline.bodyText:
Same reason here.

Actually, I think it is not the method's responsibility to verify the instructor privilege here. As long as the pre-condition for getInstructorOfCourseFromRequest is fulfilled, it should executed.


The login check should be only verified at L110 (where you delete the old code)
The caller method should verify that the entity is instructor (I think already is as checkAccessControlForInstructorFeedbackSubmission).
timeline.author: xpdavid

timeline.message: Set up base access control modifications
